events.name: Devastating flood in Kabul, May 2022
events.wd_description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.
events.description: A devastating flood in Kabul and 12 other provinces resulted in 22 deaths, 40 injuries, and widespread destruction of homes and crops amid an ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan.

events.name: Impact on Kabul and provinces
events.wd_description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.
events.description: The flood severely affected 12 provinces, with the worst impact in Badghis, Fyrab, and Baghlan, leading to 22 deaths, 40 injuries, destruction of 500 houses, and loss of 3000 acres of crops.

events.name: Humanitarian crisis and response
events.wd_description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.
events.description: The ongoing humanitarian crisis in Afghanistan worsened due to the flood, with the Red Cross providing aid while the international community grapples with how to assist without legitimizing the Taliban.

events.name: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_label: Putin threatens retaliation against NATO expansion
events.wd_description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.
events.description: Vladimir Putin threatened that Russia would retaliate if NATO established military facilities in Finland and Sweden after they agreed to join the US-led alliance.

events.name: Putin's statement
events.wd_description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.
events.description: At a press conference in Ashgabat, Turkmenistan, Putin stated that Finland and Sweden could join NATO if they chose, but warned that Russia would respond symmetrically if military contingents and equipment were installed there.

events.name: Russia's previous warnings
events.wd_description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.
events.description: Russia has frequently warned Finland and Sweden against joining NATO, claiming that severe military and political repercussions would compel it to bolster its defenses in the Baltic Sea area, including deploying nuclear weapons.

events.name: Finland and Sweden's NATO bid
events.wd_description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.
events.description: Finland and Sweden's push to join NATO gained traction in response to Russia’s war with Ukraine, seeking more security assurances from the alliance.

events.name: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_label: South Korea to boost defense capabilities
events.wd_description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.
events.description: South Korean Defense Minister Lee Jong-sup announced plans to boost defense capabilities by working with the US and Japan to counter North Korea’s nuclear and missile threat.

events.name: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_label: Urging North Korea to end programs
events.wd_description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.
events.description: Lee urged North Korea to end its nuclear weapon and missile programs during an Asian security meeting in Singapore.

events.name: Strengthening defense capabilities
events.wd_description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.
events.description: Lee stated that South Korea will strengthen capabilities to better implement the US extended deterrence and enhance response capabilities to deter North Korea’s threats.

events.name: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_label: Security cooperation with US and Japan
events.wd_description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.
events.description: Lee expressed interest in strengthening security cooperation between South Korea, the US, and Japan to respond to North Korea’s nuclear and missile programs.

events.name: Economic support for North Korea
events.wd_description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.
events.description: Lee mentioned that South Korea is ready to extend economic support if North Korea makes substantial progress in ending its nuclear program.

events.name: US EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_label: US EV Battery Supply Chain Development
events.wd_description: The U.S. faces challenges in competing in the global battery race for electric vehicles, with new initiatives to boost domestic battery production and supply chains.
events.description: The U.S. faces challenges in competing in the global battery race for electric vehicles, with new initiatives to boost domestic battery production and supply chains.

events.name: Infrastructure Bill Support
events.wd_description: The bipartisan infrastructure bill allocates $7.5 billion toward a national network of EV chargers and $3.16 billion to produce more batteries and components in the U.S.
events.description: The bipartisan infrastructure bill allocates $7.5 billion toward a national network of EV chargers and $3.16 billion to produce more batteries and components in the U.S.

events.name: EV Charger Network
events.wd_description: The infrastructure bill includes $7.5 billion for a national network of electric vehicle chargers.
events.description: The infrastructure bill includes $7.5 billion for a national network of electric vehicle chargers.

events.name: Battery Production Funding
events.wd_description: The DOE allocates $3.16 billion from the infrastructure bill to boost domestic battery production and related supply chains.
events.description: The DOE allocates $3.16 billion from the infrastructure bill to boost domestic battery production and related supply chains.

events.name: DOE Funding Allocation
events.wd_description: The DOE announces funding for new, retrofitted, and expanded battery plants, as well as battery recycling facilities.
events.description: The DOE announces funding for new, retrofitted, and expanded battery plants, as well as battery recycling facilities.

events.name: New Battery Plants
events.wd_description: Investment in the creation of new, retrofitted, and expanded battery plants.
events.description: Investment in the creation of new, retrofitted, and expanded battery plants.

events.name: Battery Recycling Facilities
events.wd_description: Investment in battery recycling facilities to support second-life applications for batteries.
events.description: Investment in battery recycling facilities to support second-life applications for batteries.

events.name: Competition with China
events.wd_description: The U.S. aims to reduce dependence on China for critical battery materials and boost its own battery production capabilities.
events.description: The U.S. aims to reduce dependence on China for critical battery materials and boost its own battery production capabilities.

events.name: Critical Minerals Strategy
events.wd_description: The U.S. focuses on securing reliable sources of critical materials like lithium, cobalt, nickel, and graphite.
events.description: The U.S. focuses on securing reliable sources of critical materials like lithium, cobalt, nickel, and graphite.

events.name: Domestic Mining Initiatives
events.wd_description: Efforts to develop domestic mining projects, such as Nevada’s Thacker Pass, to decrease reliance on imports.
events.description: Efforts to develop domestic mining projects, such as Nevada’s Thacker Pass, to decrease reliance on imports.

events.name: Battery Technology Advancements
events.wd_description: Advancements in battery technologies, including the shift towards chemistries that require less cobalt and nickel.
events.description: Advancements in battery technologies, including the shift towards chemistries that require less cobalt and nickel.
